intro: Saracha angulata, commonly known as the angular saracha, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its angular, ridged stems and broad, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Saracha angulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streambanks.
